comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13

When I have the option to switch to new new tab on an open link, I get blinded by a white page, before the web page starts to load.  Its most noticeable when I am on a dark website, and open a link in a new tab.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1.check mark option to switch to new tab when opened
2.go to a site like Hard Forum, and open a link into a new tab
3.Use a large monitor like mine, Dell U3011, 2560x1600 resolution
Actual Results:  
I get a bright white page that is blinding and very hard on my eyes.  Its causing a lot of eye strain.

Expected Results:  
no white page flash when i open a tag, just load the web page off of a dark background.
comments.creator: jamesskiles@suddenlink.net

comments.creator: albert@scheiner.cc
comments.raw_text: James, in case you still encounter this, have you tried changing the browser setting for background color? You can find this under 'Preferences > Content > Fonts & Colors > _button_ Colors > Background'
comments.text: James, in case you still encounter this, have you tried changing the browser setting for background color? You can find this under 'Preferences > Content > Fonts & Colors > _button_ Colors > Background'
comments.author: albert@scheiner.cc
